Sequence Information.Peptide Name: KR-12 R23A (synthetic AMPs, LL-37 derived, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, human cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (91.67%) toKR-12Activity: active against E. coli K12 (MIC 40 uM).Toxicity: human RBC; poor hemo.lytic (HC50>100 uM).Structure: the peptide started to have some helical feature even in PBS and became more helical upon binding to D8PG.MOA:bacteria: it can permeabilize bacterial membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Mishra B, Epand RF, Epand RM, Wang G.2013
Literature Information.Title: Structural location determines functional roles of the basic amino acids of KR-12, the smallest antimicrobial peptide from human cathelicidin LL-37
